Legal_Issue: Whether the citizenship judge erred in rejecting Mr. Rousse's application under paragraph 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Mr. Rousse's absences from Canada were due to business activities; evidence showed strong ties to Canada
Decision_Outcome: Appeal allowed; case remanded to a different citizenship judge for reconsideration
Remedy_Requested: Allowance of appeal and referral back for redetermination
Court_Ruling: The appeal is allowed due to legal error in mixing Koo and Pourghasemi criteria
Defendant_Behavior: Citizenship judge applied inconsistent legal criteria in assessment
Grounds_for_Claim: Judge incorrectly mixed residency analysis under Koo and Pourghasemi standards
Legal_Standard: Residency requirement under section 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Assessment_Factor: Physical presence and establishment of residence in Canada
Procedural_Issue: Appeal under subsection 14(5) of the Citizenship Act
Review_Standard: Correctness of legal standard applied by the judge
Evidence_Used: Evidence of Mr. Rousse's ties to Canada and nature of absences for business
Evidence_Assessed: Nature and purpose of absences, connections to Canada
Relief_Sought: Overturn of rejection and reassessment by another judge
Governing_Rule: Koo (residence establishment) or Pourghasemi (physical presence) criteria for residency
Evidentiary_Deficiency: No finding of evidentiary deficiency; rather, misapplication of law
Harm_Assessment: Unlawful denial of citizenship due to legal error
Cause_Description: Mr. Rousse's citizenship application was rejected for not meeting residency requirements
Evidence_Handling: Evidence properly submitted but misinterpreted due to incorrect legal framework
Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act â€“ improper application
Evidence_Issues: No issue with evidence itself, but with how it was evaluated
Residency_Compliance: Disputed based on interpretation of physical presence vs. residence establishment
Evidence_Assessment: Judge failed to consistently apply one legal test in evaluating evidence
Decision_Rationale: Legal inconsistency in applying both Koo and Pourghasemi frameworks led to erroneous conclusion
Evidentiary_Issues: Misapplication of legal standards in evaluating otherwise sufficient evidence
Legal_Standard_Applied: Mixed use of Koo and Pourghasemi tests, leading to legal error
